reviews.text:
Iâ€™ve frequently dined at this Smithâ€™s location
(my favorite by far), mostly for brunch (kale salad is a winner) and have always left satisfied with the great customer service and food. Recently, on two occasions I tried their dinner which was also up to par. I had the steak (butcherâ€™s cut), fries and spinach which was delicious.
Our most recent server Charlie was great and naturally lively and thorough which set the tone for the evening. Canâ€™t wait to come back to try more dinner options.
Food is meh tbh
Amazing breakfast, cool layout

Ever solid for a group outing. The staff were attentive to our table but let us gan and catch up. Explained the specials and answered menu questions politely. Food was delicious! Of course we will be back!
There was a table reservation for 7 hours, we had to wait 30 minutes! The food is delicious, I didnâ€™t like the service. Very, very noisy!
Comfort food.
Bonne nourriture, service impeccable. Attention : assez bruyant.
Amaze brunch
Solid food. Murray Hill vibes
comfort food great for burgers and sandwiches

My husband and I hosted our wedding welcome party at The Smith last September, and weâ€™re still talking about what an amazing experience it was! The service, food, and drinks were all fantastic â€” everything ran so smoothly from start to finish.
When we first moved to the city in 2013, we lived right around the corner, and The Smith quickly became our go-to brunch spot. It only felt right to bring our friends and family to a place thatâ€™s always been so special to us.
The team was incredibly accommodating, allowing us to bring our own decorations, dessert, and music, and they made sure everything came together perfectly. I canâ€™t recommend The Smith enough and would absolutely host another event here!
Lovely food and service is top notch, much too loud for my personal taste but all the same a great place to stay.
Great place to wind down after a long day at work.

Customer service was top notch! Even though it was crowded, Michael was attentive but not overbearing and super thoughtful. Really made our dining experience at The Smith super smooth and wonderful. This was our third time here but so far the best experience weâ€™ve had, thanks to Michael!

Unfortunately forgot to take pics of the food and drinks but we had the Vanilla Bean French Toast, Crispy Calamari (so good), Mac + Cheese (amazing and our kids favorite!) and Cinnamon Sugar Doughnuts (another favorite!). We also had Pool Party Slushie on the side and it was so so good!

Brussel sprouts were woody, the rest of the meal was ok.
Service was friendly but not attentive, it really lacked.
The decor was nice but not that much atmosphere as it wasnâ€™t that busy, probably because this place isnâ€™t worth returning to.
åœ°å…ƒã®äººãŒè¡Œããƒ¬ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒ³ã€‚ï¼’AVã¨ã‹ï¼‘AVã¯åœ°å…ƒã®äººé–“ãŒå¤šãã€è¦³å…‰å®¢ãŒå°‘ãªã„ã€‚

Great food! The burger was awesome. Was on the smaller size but still worth it. Their pot of mussels was good as well. Waitress was very helpful with question on menu and her recommendation for meals and drinks. She was spot on!ğŸ‘ğŸ¾ğŸ‘ğŸ¾
Best Shrimp and Grits I have had in a long time! Great spot for brunch!

My husband and I came to The Smith for dinner twice for dinner and we had to come back again to try the breakfast in a span of 2 days. The main star was the mac and cheese itâ€™s SO GOOD!! Our server Matthew was great he remembered us coming back lol the food is spectacular, the bathrooms are super cool and the music is top tier. Highly recommend if youâ€™re in midtown.
The food was really good.  Great place to meet with friends.
Solid spot for dinner. Consistent and comfortable.
Simply perfect!

I came here yesterday with my boyfriend and we had a such a great dinner!! I unfortunately didnâ€™t catch our waitressâ€™ name but she was wearing a cute pink bow in her hair and she was really great. me and my boyfriend felt like she was reading our mind because as we were thinking about our drinks or food, she would come right around the corner with it! We come here all the time, to multiple of the locations but this is our usual spot and we have a always have a nice dinner but this time, it literally was like the chef put their WHOLE HEART into our meal. i had the vodka pasta and added steak and my boyfriend got the Rib eye and the food was to die for. i always have the vodka pasta too but this time the sauce was just absolutely incredible. i wanted to lick my plate so bad haha! whoever the chef was yesterday needs to be there everyday because WOW. the food and service was just so good i needed to leave a review this time!

We went to the Smith for brunch for the first time. It was great. The Benedicts were perfect, the home fries crispy and tasty. The star was the French toast. Be forewarned that this was expensive for breakfast, even by NYC standards.
I always enjoy the food here, and it's a great environment. I would definitely recommend it.
I don't know how people can rate here as 4 stars...

Second time eating here and probably my last. Ordered Chicken Mianese, a thin pounded chicken breast with bread crumb covering. It was like a piece of cardboard. Hard and dry. The chicken parm was the exact same thing, with melted cheese. The Mac and cheese for kids did not go over very well. My granddaughter had to order something else. I did like the bottles of water and sparkling water provided to the tables.

Had a great Sunday brunch here.  My daughter said the breakfast sandwich was the best she's had.  My French toast was a monster piece of bread.  Nice location - indoor and outdoor seating.  Busy, but we had reservations.

Good menu selection for brunch, lunch & dinner. If you have friends in town, this is a good option to take them. Recommendation: make your reservations ahead because it gets busy, especially for brunch.
Great food, lovely service. The prices are also good compared to other places in the vicinity.
Very tasty and generously proportioned food. Excellent service. A go-to spot when visiting NYC.
Ok
The best breakfast we had in New York! My husband got the eggs Benedict and it was beyond good! I would definitely recommend The Smith.
Had the roasted salmon and my partner had the mussels, both fell ill within the hour.
Great location in midtown East side. Get a nice portion for plate side. Great tasting food! Great selection on menu!
The food was incredible.
8 oysters, 6 shrimp and salmon tartare for 39 was on point.
Mi lugar favorito!!!!.... amo las ensaladas con queso azul, pasta deliciosa, cocktails A1, sandwiches exquisitos. Simplemente me encanta

A long time restaurant for a reason. Quality food prepared with expertise. Mac n cheese is always a must. Oysters are the cleanest and freshest around. Burgers are proper. Drinks are creative and delicious.

Iâ€™ve been to the NoMad location and raved about their burger with bacon shallot jam, but this was my first time at the Midtown location, and my first time trying their weekend brunch.

We started with cinnamon sugar doughnuts, served withÂ hot fudge dipping sauce. These were gone in seconds!

I shared the Smith eggs Benedict, served with black forest ham on an English muffin and a side of breakfast potatoes. The English muffin was a bit tough to cut, but the flavors were all delicious.

My family loved the baked eggs alla vodka, which looked to me like the Italian version of Shakshouka â€” eggs served in vodka sauce with a side of toasted ciabatta.
Good NY dinner. Nothing stands out, nothing bad either.

Writing to warn anyone doing takeout to look at your order before you leave the restaurant. We often eat at the Smith since it's close to my daughter's apartment and occasionally order takeout salads. Yesterday, my husband ordered three of the kale and quinoa salads which run $28 and $31 for chicken or salmon. We ordered one with salmon and two with double chicken for extra protein, so the two with chicken were $38 EACH! We knew that going in, but when we got the salads home, the amount of actual salad was shocking. It was a fraction of what we get when eating in the restaurant. This in not how it has always been. Especially when we order from the non Midtown location (this is a common takeout order for us). It was honestly so disappointing that someone could box that up, and send off that puny salad in good conscience, knowing the prices there.  There should be some portion control if you're paying the same as if eating in house. We are currently looking for new takeout options in the area to replace this staple. Be warned. The salad that would usually fill this container is only half full. There wasn't even enough kale with the chicken to have kale in every bite. This was over $100 for three salads.

Really enjoyed the restaurant. The food and service was great. The only thing that was not good was the noise level
. I would definitely recommend  having a meal there.

Great location, great staff, great food!. Good quality for the price, fantastic bar and great food selection. Try the salmon with poached egg over waffle potatoes. Absolutely delicious. Their salads are very nice as well. Great place for brunch or dinner.
Very solid brunch. The restaurant is huge so the tables are nicely spread out. Happy

Amazing customer service! Shoutout to the waiter who was so organized and announced his every move: drinks, appetizers, entrees, confirm if we needed anything else and then the bill! He was so determined! The restaurant was full and just with our group, the outdoor dining was completely full! The attention, ambiance, food and service were all perfect! I chose pasta and it was exactly how I requested it to be! Definitely a place you visit more than once!

We came here on a Monday for a late lunch, and there was hardly anyone here, so it was nice and quiet.  Service was very good! The food was good, but nothing exceptional. We had the half chicken sausage + eggs and the Smith Eggs Benedict. We also had a latte and cappuccino, which were also good, fairly standard.

We had our wedding dinner reception at The Smith Restaurant, we rented out a private dining for us and our guests. And everything was amazing, from the room set up to the staff being so nice, helpful, sweet & lovely. We showed them how we wanted the table to be set and it was spot on. The service was amazing. The food was delicious. Big thanks to the manager Craig for sorting things out and also for the manager on Duty that night. Everything went well as the way we wanted. The ambiance & vibe is so nice and made us so happy. Over all the experience was brilliant. 10/10 Would highly recommend this place!

not many burgers in the menu but their classic one was perfect, literally so good, fries were yummy too. probably one of the best burgers iâ€™ve ever had! they also have a plant based one, my friend likes it
desserts were good too

The food is delicious  I went to another location but this location is just as good love the Smith. We had the nuggets for an appetizer the spicy peach jam was amazing. I had the brick pressed chicken and it was delicious. Will come back again for sure love it here!

The weekend brunch is delicious! From the Smith burger that I had to the Shrimp grits that my guests had! There's a lot to choose from on the menu so I will be back for something else ğŸ˜‹. Expresso martini and coconut pie for dessert.

We tried this place as a recommendation and it turned out great. The food is good, with great variety, service is nice, except that it was a bit busy and it wasnâ€™t so fast, and it is located on a very convenient location.
We tasted the Oysters ğŸ¦ª and than the burgers ğŸ” and they were delicious.
Definitely a good choice.

Comforting atmosphere with some amazing food and friendly staff. Compliments to the cooks as well everything looks so good. This is a dinner spot you can count on for a great time and amazing plates.

Friday Scallop Special & The vodka pasta for my girlfriend 5 stars

itâ€™s super crowded, so definitely reserve in advance! Perfect spot for large groups, they have fast service and really delicious food. Everything we ordered was great, especially the kale salad and the spicy shrimp pasta

I got the baked eggs alla vodka and the frozen paradise colada. I loved the egg dish, it was simple but perfectly done. The colada was good as well but nothing noteworthy. It is a more pricey restaurant as an egg dish shouldnâ€™t really cost over $20. However, the atmosphere inside was lovely and be sure to go downstairs to use their photo booth.
First time in NYC, First restaurant we sat at - still on top of the list even after a week trying out different spots. Everything was super delicious and the staff was very caring of us ğŸ‘ŒğŸ»

Very delicious breakfast options! We came back every day to try more. Benedict eggs and salmon toast are my favourite â¤ï¸
Atmosphere of retro cafe also very nice and welcoming!

Had a delicious dinner with my husband at The Smith this weekend. We ordered the Mac and cheese to share and I got the skirt steak with Caesar salad and he got the brick pressed chicken. Everything was so delicious and fresh.

There was about a 30 to 40 minute wait when we arrived. As soon as we got seated we were greeted by our lovely waitress Shannon who was absolutely lovely and very attentive. Our drinks came and food came out very quickly & everything was absolutely delicious! Definitely worth the wait!

All locations of The Smith are fantastic. I have been eating at the NYC locations for many years.
The atmosphere is great, service is always friendly, the menu is large, and the food and drinks are great, especially the burger.
The Smith Midtown (and NoMad) is a great spot for a good meal at any time of the day or night, or drinks at the bar.

I came here for a Time Left dinner and the whole thing just felt unorganized from the host having me wait at the bar until the group got there, then forgetting to tell me she seated the group already, to it being so loud you couldn't hold a conversation with the person at the opposite end of the table. The food wasn't bad but not stellar, and service was fine for such a busy spot. Overall, I don't think I'd go back.
